text.neepmeat.plc.interactive_help:
Click an instruction in the right panel to select it.

Click a block in a the world to add its position as an argument.

Once the required number of arguments are filled, the instruction will be executed immediately.
tooltip.neepmeat.plc.language:
Current programming language: %s
Click to switch language.
CTRL-click to open documentation.
block.neepmeat.crusher_segment.lore_0: Enables advanced crushing recipes. Up to four are allowed per machine.
block.neepmeat.largest_hopper.lore_0: It's a very large hopper. Perhaps the largest.
block.neepmeat.stomach.lore_0: Also acts as a fluid input.
block.neepmeat.lucky_one.lore_0: +100% chance of extra outputs (max +200%). Must be receiving ≥50eJ/t of vascular power.
block.neepmeat.extractor.lore_0: Allows a Phage Ray to harvest blocks. Drops are deposited in a connected item output.
block.neepmeat.fluid_pipe.desc:
§7Place on the side of a pipe or other block to connect.
§eHold sneak to place with no connections.§7
§eUse with an empty hand or Tissue Operator to toggle connection.§7
Pipes will only connect to a matching colour.
§eSneak-scroll to cycle colour.§7
block.neepmeat.encased_fluid_pipe.lore_0: Takes on the model and shape of the block it is right-clicked with.
block.neepmeat.stop_valve.lore_0: Prevents flow when closed. Responds to redstone.
block.neepmeat.check_valve.lore_0: Only allows flow in one direction.
block.neepmeat.filter_pipe.lore_0: Only allows a specific fluid type through.
block.neepmeat.filter_pipe.lore_1: §eRight-click with a fluid container to set the filter.§f
block.neepmeat.limiter_valve.lore_0: Controls the rate at which fluid passes.
block.neepmeat.limiter_valve.lore_1: Set the maximum flow rate in the GUI.
block.neepmeat.item_pipe.desc:
§7Place on the side of a pipe or other block to connect.
§eHold sneak to place with no connections.§7
§eUse with an empty hand or Tissue Operator to toggle connection.§7
block.neepmeat.item_pipe.lore_0: Items must be inserted with an Ejector or Item Pump.
block.neepmeat.filter_item_pipe.lore_0:
Admits items based on the provided filter.
§eUse with an empty hand while sneaking to configure,
block.neepmeat.speed_item_pipe.lore_0: Max speed is reached with two accelerator pipes.
block.neepmeat.opaque_item_pipe.lore_0: Items must be inserted with an Ejector or Item Pump.
block.neepmeat.encased_item_pipe.lore_0: Takes on the model and shape of the block it is right-clicked with.
block.neepmeat.pipe_driver.lore_0: Permits advanced item routing in connected item pipes. One Driver is allowed per network.
block.neepmeat.item_requester.lore_0: Lists all available items in a connected item pipe network. Requested items will be routed towards this pipe. A Pipe Driver must be part of the network.
block.neepmeat.storage_bus.lore_0:
Allows adjacent inventories to fulfil item requests.
§eSneak-use to configure priority.§f
block.neepmeat.vertical_gauge.lore_0:
Displays the last value that was written to its address.
Sneak-click to configure ports and range
block.neepmeat.slider.lore_0:
Interactive component with configurable range.
Writes its value to all devices with a matching address in a NEEPBus network.
Sneak-click to configure ports.
block.neepmeat.slanted_slider.lore_0:
Interactive component with configurable range.
Writes its value to all devices with a matching address in a NEEPBus network.
Sneak-click to configure ports.
screen.neepmeat.slider.instructions:
Use W and S or scroll to change value.
Hold SHIFT to use 1/10 divisions.
Press ESC to exit.
block.neepmeat.single_button.lore_0:
Writes its value to the selected address when used. Does not support reading.
When Pulse length > 0, the button will write 0 to the address after the delay.
§eSneak-use to configure.§f
block.neepmeat.data_cable.lore_0:
Connects Integrators to other blocks.
Transmits NEEPBus signals.
Use a Tissue Operator to change connections.
block.neepmeat.redstone_transducer.lore_:
Converts NEEPBus signals to redstone strength and vice versa.
Sneak-click with a Networking Tool to configure ports.
block.neepmeat.pid_controller.lore_0:
A versatile feedback controller. Tries to match §eMeasurement§7 input with §eSetpoint§7 by changing §eOutput§7.
The output is the weighted sum of three control terms: proportional, integral and derivative. Each term has a configurable gain (kp, ki and kd) that can be tuned to better match the system being controlled.
An integral windup limit can also be configured to prevent the accumulation of error when the setpoint changes.
block.neepmeat.address_decoder.lore_0: Redirects signals from §eData§7 to a numerically-named address specified by the §eAddress§7 input. Addresses 0-63 can be accessed.
block.neepmeat.delay.lore_0: When data is written to its input, waits one tick before writing to its output.
block.neepmeat.lore_0: Applies an arithmetical operation to §eInput 1§7 and §eInput 2§7 and sends the result via §eResult§7.
block.neepmeat.movement_control.lore_0:
Converts a player's movement inputs to NEEPBus signals.
§eUse to activate
Sneak-use to configure.
block.neepmeat.integrator.lore_0:
Reads the input port and adds it to a stored variable which is then sent to the output port. Equivalent to integrating with the forward Euler method.
§eSneak-click to clear§f
block.neepmeat.vascular_conduit.lore_0: Cycles blood through machines to give them power.
Takes on the model and shape of the block it is right-clicked with.
block.neepmeat.vsc.lore_0:
Consumes a configurable amount of power from a vascular network and emits it from the front. Useful for controlling the speed of motors.
§eDisabled by redstone by default. Use with an empty hand while sneaking to toggle.
block.neepmeat.vascular_sensor.lore_0: Sends properties of the connected vascular network via NEEPBus.
block.neepmeat.pump.lore_0:
Pumps fluid quickly through pipes.
§eEnabled by redstone by default. Use with an empty hand while sneaking to toggle.
block.neepmeat.item_pump.lore_0:
Requests and ejects stacks of sixteen into connected pipes.
§eEnabled by redstone by default. Use with an empty hand while sneaking to toggle.
block.neepmeat.ejector.lore_0:
Ejects single items into connected pipes.
§eEnabled by redstone by default. Use with an empty hand while sneaking to toggle.
block.neepmeat.filtered_ejector.lore_0:
Ejects single items into connected pipes based on a configurable filter.
§eEnabled by redstone by default. Use with an empty hand while sneaking to toggle.
block.neepmeat.advanced_ejector.lore_0:
'S more advanced innit.
§eUse with an empty hand while sneaking to configure§f
block.neepmeat.transposer.lore_0: Ejects inserted items inserted with hoppers into item pipes.
block.neepmeat.item_interface.lore_0: Acts as a proxy for the block it faces.
block.neepmeat.chute.lore_0: Deposits items thrown at it into the storage it faces when open.
block.neepmeat.buffer.lore_0: Holds nine stacks. Extraction can be disabled with redstone.
block.neepmeat.content_detector.lore_0: Detects certain items in the inventory it faces. Filter items can be added and removed with hoppers.
block.neepmeat.solidity_detector.lore_0: Emits redstone when the block it faces is not air or fluid.
block.neepmeat.flex_tank.lore_0: Capacity is increased by adding more blocks
block.neepmeat.advanced_flex_tank.lore_0: Capacity is increased by adding more blocks
block.neepmeat.fluid_buffer.lore_0: Holds a bucket's worth of fluid.
block.neepmeat.fluid_interface.lore_0: Acts as a proxy for the block it faces.
block.neepmeat.fluid_gauge.lore_0: Emits redstone based on a tank's fill percentage.
block.neepmeat.item_gauge.lore_0: Emits redstone based on an inventory's fill percentage.
block.neepmeat.transducer.lore_0: Pierces the skein to become part of the circulatory system of §kooooeoe§r.
block.neepmeat.power_flower_seeds.lore_0: Can be placed on dirt or grass. Grows into a majestic organic generator.
block.neepmeat.power_flower_growth.lore_:
Forms the structure of a Power Flower organism. 
Specialises into a photosynthetic organ when the upper face is exposed to the air, otherwise, it increases digestion rate.
Spreads when given bone meal or flesh. 
Can be harvested with silk-touch.
block.neepmeat.power_flower_fluid_port.l: Sucks water or liquid food into a Power Flower.
block.neepmeat.power_flower_controller.l:
Emits Transient Ichor generated by a Power Flower. 
Requires water inserted through a Power Flower Fluid Port. 
Can be harvested normally.
block.neepmeat.fluid_exciter.lore_0: Injects power into a vascular network connected to the upper dome when Transient Ichor is inserted into the bottom. Provides a 150% efficiency gain over standard motors.
block.neepmeat.item_buffer.lore_0: §eUse with an empty hand while sneaking to configure capacity.§f
block.neepmeat.router.lore_0: Distributes items based on simple item filters.
block.neepmeat.advanced_router.lore_0: Distributes items based on multiple advanced filters.
block.neepmeat.grinder.lore_0: §eUse with an empty hand while sneaking to eject XP.
block.neepmeat.heater.lore_0: Heats the furnace or furnace-like block it faces. Cooking speed increases by 1x base with every 60eJ/t supplied. Can also oxidise copper that is exposed to Patina Treatment.
block.neepmeat.integrator_egg.lore_0: It pulsates, inexplicably communicating a desire for blood.
block.neepmeat.mixer.lore_0: Mixes items and fluids from adjacent tanks.
block.neepmeat.mixer.lore_1: Items must be inserted with pipes or hoppers.
block.neepmeat.motor_unit.lore_0:
Powers mechanical blocks. Runs on Transient Ichor.
Max output power: 400eJ/t
block.neepmeat.advanced_motor.lore_0:
Powers mechanical blocks. Takes power from a connected vascular network.
Max output power: 800eJ/t
block.neepmeat.large_motor.lore_0:
Powers mechanical blocks.
Max output power: 2000eJ/t
block.neepmeat.assembler.lore_0: Replicates a pattern of items in the inventory below. Place above Persistent Crafting Table for auto-crafting.
block.neepmeat.fabricator.lore_0:
Crafts items using ingredients from adjacent inventories.
Crafting can be triggered by extracting the result item from the front.
If powered by a motor, it will continuously craft and eject items.
Loops and chains are not allowed.
block.neepmeat.workstation.lore_1: Used with the Assembler for auto-crafting.
block.neepmeat.death_blades.lore_0: Macerates mobs, producing Tissue Slurry in drains below.
block.neepmeat.item_mincer.lore_0:
Crushes food items into Liquid Food. 
The hunger and saturation values of the food item are reflected in the quality of the Food. 
Foods of different qualities can be mixed in NEEPMeat tanks.
block.neepmeat.feeding_trough.lore_0:
Breeds animals within a 5x5 area when filled with Animal Feed. Consumes 1/6 buckets per breed.
Feed can be inserted by clicking with grain or a Gland Potato, but is more efficiently produced in a mixer.
Attaching a motor increases breeding rate.
block.neepmeat.separator.lore_0: Moves adult or baby animals from the 5x2x5 space it faces to the block directly behind it. Requires >0eJ/t to run.
block.neepmeat.separator.lore_1: It's the Chronotyper from MFR. I couldn't think of a creative alternative.
block.neepmeat.synthesiser.lore_0:
Replicates mobs when supplied with meat.
§eUse with the desired mob's Essential Saltes to insert them.
Can be disabled with redstone.
block.neepmeat.fluid_rationer.lore_0:
Ejects discrete fluid amounts from the facing storage into a pipe network.
Can also extract buckets of fluid from full cauldrons.
block.neepmeat.surgery_platform.lore_0: Allows implants to be applied to entities.
block.neepmeat.robotic_arm.lore_0: A PLC actuator that can operate at high speed when given enough power.
block.neepmeat.implanter.lore_0: Installs implants into entities. Can be operated manually or via a PLC with the ROBOT instruction.
block.neepmeat.executor.lore_0:
Executes instructions sent by an external PLC using the 'exec' instruction. Uses the actuator it faces.
§eUse with an empty hand while sneaking to reset the instruction queue.
block.neepmeat.plc_neepbus_interface.lor:
Emits an interrupt when its port is written to.
Writes the given value when it receives a memory entry.
block.neepmeat.upgrade_manager.lore_0: Removes and tweaks item or entity implants. Must be placed facing a Surgery Platform.
block.neepmeat.small_compressor.lore_0: Burns fuel to compress air. Powers rock drill in a 16x16x16 cube.
item.neepmeat.sacrificial_dagger.lore_0:
Also acts as a wrench.
Entities produce blood when killed above a Drain.
Use and hold to vivisect.
item.neepmeat.animal_heart.lore_0: Crude; it lacks any logical design sensibilities.
item.neepmeat.reanimated_heart.lore_0: It is said by some that the reanimated exude health.
item.neepmeat.machine_fluid.lore_0: What secrets could it have gleaned from those inhuman minds?
item.neepmeat.digestive_system.lore_0: A tube lined with specialised tissues.
item.neepmeat.control_unit.lore_0: So that meat and machine may think as one.
item.neepmeat.brain_rough.lore_0: It will never see thoughts again, but it may still be of use.
item.neepmeat.enlightened_brain.lore_0: Although still dead, it has undergone
item.neepmeat.advanced_integration_charg: Capable of dragging even the most stubborn flesh back to life.
item.neepmeat.whisper_flour.lore_0: Its grains hold terrible secrets of the cosmos.
item.neepmeat.flesh_potato.lore_0: Something has mutated it to an Enlightened
item.neepmeat.flesh_potato.lore_1: form. It exudes the heady scent of the Divine.
item.neepmeat.blood_bubble.lore_0: A membranous sac of animal blood.
block.neepmeat.blood_bubble_planks_press: Only emits a signal into the block below.
block.neepmeat.core_sensor.lore_0: Exposes the receiver organism's variables to a NEEPBus network.
block.neepmeat.holding_track.lore_0: Holds carts in place when unpowered.
block.neepmeat.control_track.lore_0:
Boosts a cart in the direction a riding player wishes to move.
When unpowered, it will hold the cart in place until the player uses the motion keys.
block.neepmeat.dumping_track.lore_0: Drops the riding entity directly below the track.
item.neepmeat.projector.lore_0: A guide to all NEEPMeat content.
item.neepmeat.projector.lore_1: Press §fCTRL + L§7 to look up a hovered item while this guide is in your inventory.
item.neepmeat.pipette.lore_0:
Holds up to one bucket of fluid.
Use on a block to extract or deposit fluid.
§eSneak-click on a block that cannot contain fluid to dump contents.
item.neepmeat.networking_tool.lore_0:
Connects NEEPBus ports together.
§eUse on the sender block and scroll to choose the output port.
Use on the receiver block and scroll to choose the port.
Sneak-use any NEEPBus block to configure its ports.§f
screen.neepmeat.networking_tool.instruct: Scroll to select the desired port. Click to copy its address.
Scroll to select the desired port. Click to set its address.
Click anywhere to clear the stored address.
item.neepmeat.dosimeter.lore_0: Determines the instantaneous dose of Enlightenment at the current position. Cannot determine the acute and chronic effects.
item.neepmeat.rock_drill.lore_0: Instantly breaks stone and similar blocks when within 16 blocks of a running Small Compressor.
item.neepmeat.transforming_tool_base.lor: Can combine two items into one.
item.neepmeat.pinkdrink.lore_0: It's pink and it's refreshing so don't ask what's in it.
block.neepmeat.cronencake.lore_0: Ignore the screams. It's probably not sentient.
block.neepmeat.charnel_compactor.lore_0: Converts flesh into Integration Fluid when connected to an Integrator.
message.neepmeat.compactor.immature: The connected Integrator organism is not fully grown.
block.neepmeat.well_head.lore_0: Receives writhing earths liberated by a nearby Charnel Pump. Must be placed on a Writhing Earth Spout.
block.neepmeat.phage_ray.lore_0: Fires a beam that rapidly breaks blocks when ridden and aimed by a player. Blocks do not drop loot when broken.
item.neepmeat.essential_saltes.lore_0: Use in a Synthesiser to replicate an organism.
item.neepmeat.mob_egg.lore_0: Hatches when immersed in blood or injected with blood by a PLC.
item.neepmeat.compound_injector_lore_1: Click this item with a %s in an inventory slot to reload.
item.neepmeat.farming_scutter.lore_0:
Harvests and replants crops. Must be placed on farmland. Harvested items will be inserted into block that is highlighted when placing.
§eSneak-use to pick up.§f
message.neepmeat.implant.title: Implant
message.neepmeat.item_implant.title: Item Implant
implant.neepmeat.extra_mouth.desc_0: Automatically consumes food from one's inventory. Tries not to waste food, but prioritises high saturation when two or more hearts are lost.
implant.neepmeat.extra_knees.desc_0: Increases step height to one block.
implant.neepmeat.lung_extensions.desc_0: Scream LONGER. Breathe HARDER. Brag about EXTENDED LUNGS.
implant.neepmeat.claws.desc_0: Gives +4 attack damage when holding nothing.
implant.neepmeat.spider_legs.desc_0: Increases speed and gives smoother traversal over full blocks.
implant.neepmeat.shield.desc_0: Shields some damage when the item is in use.
implant.neepmeat.living_tool_implant.des: Converts any item into an organism that runs on Transient Ichor. Durability can be replenished in a Bottler.
item.neepmeat.chrysalis.lore_0: Something tells you that surgically implanting this into a cow would be a really good idea.
message.neepmeat.workpiece.title: Workpiece
instruction.neepmeat.ret.desc: Jumps to the top instruction address in the call stack. Use a function instead of this.
instruction.neepmeat.call.desc: Pushes the current instruction address to the call stack and jumps the given label. Use a function instead of this.
instruction.neepmeat.ihandler.desc:
Registers an interrupt handler for a block. When an interrupt request occurs, the PLC will call the specified label. Use RET to return to the program position before the interrupt was handled.
 §6ARG1§f: Interrupt emitter (world target)
 §6ARG2§f: Label to call on interrupt.
instruction.neepmeat.iwait.desc:
Puts the PLC on standby until an interrupt is triggered externally.
Enables interrupt handling if it has been disabled.
instruction.neepmeat.idisable.desc:
Disables interrupt handling without clearing interrupt handlers.
Use to disable further interrupts when one is currently being handled.
instruction.neepmeat.push.desc:
§6( -- n1 )§f
Pushes the given immediate variable to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.pop.desc:
§6( n1 -- )§f
Removes the top element from the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.swp.desc:
§6( n1 n2 -- n2 n1 )§f
Swaps the order of the top two stack elements.
instruction.neepmeat.dup.desc:
§6( n1 -- n1 n1 )§f
Duplicates the top element on the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.over.desc:
§6( n1 n2 -- n1 n2 n1 )§f
Duplicates the second element on the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.rot.desc:
§6( n1 n2 n3 -- n2 n3 n1 )§f
Moves the third element on the stack to the top.
instruction.neepmeat.pick.desc:
§6( x -- n_x )§f
Copies the element x places from the top of the stack to the top of the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.rto.desc:
§6( n1 -- ) ( R: -- n1 )§f
Moves the top element of the data stack to the return stack.
instruction.neepmeat.rfrom.desc:
§6( -- n1 ) ( R: n1 -- )§f
Moves the top element of the return stack to the data stack.
instruction.neepmeat.rfetch.desc:
§6( -- n1 ) ( R: n1 -- n1 )§f
Copies the top element of the return stack to the data stack.
instruction.neepmeat.free.desc: Frees the memory at the address on the top of the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.store.desc:
§6( n1 addr -- )§f
Stores n1 stack entry in the PLC's memory at addr
instruction.neepmeat.fetch.desc:
§6( addr -- n1 )§f
Attempts to fetch the value in memory at the address on the top of the stack.
Pushes the result to the stack.
DOES NOT FREE THE MEMORY.
instruction.neepmeat.extstore.desc:
Sends the memory entry pointed to by the address on the top of the stack to the target block.
DOES NOT FREE THE MEMORY.
 §6ARG1§f: Block with memory stack (world target)
instruction.neepmeat.extfetch.desc:
Moves the top entry in the target block's memory stack to the PLC's memory.
Pushes the address of the newly allocated memory to the stack.
Remember to free the memory when it is no longer needed with FREE.
 §6ARG1§f: Block with memory stack (world target)
instruction.neepmeat.delay.desc: Waits for the specified number of ticks.
instruction.neepmeat.eq.desc: Pops and checks the top two stack elements for equality. .
instruction.neepmeat.lt.desc:
Pops and checks if the second-last stack element is less than the top stack element.
Pushes the result to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.lteq.desc:
Pops and checks if the second-last stack element is less than or equal to the top
Pushes the result to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.gt.desc:
Pops and checks if the second-last stack element is greater than the top stack element.
Pushes the result to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.gteq.desc:
Pops and checks if the second-last stack element is greater than or equal to last stack element.
Pushes the result to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.neg.desc: Inverts the sign of the top stack element.
instruction.neepmeat.add.desc:
Pops the top two stack elements.
Sums them. 
The result is pushed to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.sub.desc:
Pops the top two stack elements.
Subtracts the first from the last. 
The result is pushed to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.mul.desc:
Pops the top two stack elements.
Multiplies them. 
The result is pushed to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.div.desc:
Pops the top two stack elements.
Divides the first by the last. 
The result is pushed to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.not.desc: Computes the bitwise §6complement§f of the last stack entry.
instruction.neepmeat.and.desc:
Pops the top two stack elements.
Computes their bitwise §6AND§f.
The result is pushed to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.or.desc:
Pops the top two stack elements.
Computes their bitwise §6OR§f.
The result is pushed to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.nand.desc:
Pops the top two stack elements.
Computes their bitwise §6NAND§f.
The result is pushed to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.nor.desc:
Pops the top two stack elements.
Computes their bitwise §6NOR§f.
The result is pushed to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.xor.desc:
Pops the top two stack elements.
Computes their bitwise §6XOR§f.
The result is pushed to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.xnor.desc:
Pops the top two stack entries.
Computes their bitwise §6XNOR§f.
The result is pushed to the stack.
instruction.neepmeat.shr.desc: Bit-shifts the top stack element §6right§f by the give number of bits.
instruction.neepmeat.shl.desc: Bit-shifts the top stack element §6left§f by the give number of bits.
instruction.neepmeat.jmp.desc:
Jumps to the given label or by the given number of instructions. 
If the label is followed by §6f§f or §6b§f, it will jump to the next or previous instance of the label.
instruction.neepmeat.bit.desc:
(Branch if true) Branches to the given label or number of instructions if the top stack element is §6greater than zero§f.
If the label is followed by §6f§f or §6b§f, it will jump to the next or previous instance of the label.
instruction.neepmeat.bif.desc:
(Branch if false) Branches to the given label or number of instructions if the top stack element is §6zero or negative§f.
If the label is followed by §6f§f or §6b§f, it will jump to the next or previous instance of the label.
instruction.neepmeat.say.desc:
Sends the given string to all players within 20 blocks.
If no string is provided, it will pop and print the last stack element.
Adding §6d§f §6h§' or §6b§f to the end will format the stack entry as decimal, hexadecimal or binary respectively.
instruction.neepmeat.remove.desc: Removes the last manufacture step from the item in workbench ARG1.
instruction.neepmeat.robot.desc: Selects the actuator at ARG1. All further instructions will use the actuator until a new one is selected.
instruction.neepmeat.exec.desc: Runs the following instruction ARG2 in the executor at block ARG1.
instruction.neepmeat.combine.desc: Removes an item from storage ARG1 and combines it with the item in workbench ARG2.
instruction.neepmeat.move.desc:
Tries to the specified number of items from storage ARG1 into storage ARG2. If no amount is specified, 64 will be assumed. The success of the move is pushed to the stack.
 §6ARG1§f: Source storage (world target)
 §6ARG2§f: destination storage (world target)
 §6ARG3§f: amount (integer, optional)
 §6ARG4§f: item ID (string, * for wildcard, optional)
instruction.neepmeat.implant.desc: Removes an item from storage ARG1 and surgically implants it into entity ARG2.
instruction.neepmeat.inject.desc: Draws fluid from storage ARG1 and injects it into the item in workbench ARG2.
instruction.neepmeat.wait_redstone.desc: Waits for a signal strength above zero at the redstone interface ARG1.
instruction.neepmeat.emit_redstone.desc:
Emits a redstone signal at ARG1 of strength ARG2. If no strength is specified, it will be read from the stack.
 §6ARG1§f: redstone interface (world target)
 §6ARG2§f: signal strength (integer, optional)
instruction.neepmeat.read_redstone.desc:
Reads the redstone signal strength at ARG1 and pushes it to the stack.
 §6ARG1§f: redstone interface (world target)
instruction.neepmeat.neepbus_write.desc:
Sends the top stack entry to all devices with the specified address in a connected NEEPBus network.
 §6ARG1§f: target address (string)
instruction.neepmeat.neepbus_read.desc:
Reads the value of a device with the specified address in a connected NEEPBus network.
 §6ARG1§f: target address (string)
instruction.neepmeat.route.desc:
Uses a Pipe Driver (currently selected as the actuator) to request the item with the given name. 
The item is routed from a given §6pipe§f and §6input direction§f to the specified §6pipe§f and §6output direction§f. The desired count is read from the stack and the success of the operation is pushed to the stack.
 §6ARG1§f: input pipe (world target)
 §6ARG2§f: output pipe (world target)
 §6ARG2§f item ID (string, * for wildcard)
instruction.neepmeat.request.desc:
Uses a Pipe Driver (currently selected as the actuator) to request the item with the given name. 
The item is routed through a pipe network to the specified §6pipe§f and §6output direction§f. The desired count is read from the stack and the success of the request is pushed to the stack.
 §6ARG1§f: output pipe (world target)
 §6ARG2§f item ID (string, * for wildcard)
instruction.neepmeat.count.desc:
Counts the items or fluid at the given world target and pushes the result to the stack.
The type of resource to count is optionally specified in the second argument.
If an ID is provided, only items/fluids of that that match it will be counted. IDs can use * to represent any combination of characters (*:water or minecraft:*).
 §6ARG1§f: inventory (world target)§6
 §6ARG2§f: type to count (ITEM or FLUID, optional)
 §6ARG3§f: item or fluid ID (string, optional)
screen.neepmeat.limiter_valve.text.ej_t_: Esoteric joules per tick with reference to Transient Ichor (one bucket = 162000eJ)
screen.neepmeat.content_detector.regulat: Stays powered until all filter items have left
screen.neepmeat.content_detector.absolut: Stays powered only while conditions are met
advancements.neepmeat.main.root.title: NEEPMeat
Craft your Owner's Manual with Rotten Flesh and a book.
advancements.neepmeat.main.obtain_integr: Obtain an Integrator Egg from a dungeon chest.
advancements.neepmeat.main.enlightenment: Use a Pedestal connected to an Integrator to produce strange new forms.
advancements.neepmeat.main.obtain_enligh: Advance a brain to its Enlightened form.
advancements.neepmeat.main.obtain_whispe: The Yeast of Thoughts and Minds
Crush some Whisper Wheat into Whisper Flour.
advancements.neepmeat.main.place_ejector: Use an Ejector to insert items into pipes.
screen.neepmeat.vsc.normal.desc: Normal: The specified amount of power will be drawn from the source network and injected into the target network.
screen.neepmeat.vsc.balance.desc: Balance: The VSC will try to keep the available power in the output network at the specified value. Excess power will be injected into the source network
death.attack.neepmeat.mincer: %1$s was reduced to a soup-like homogenate.
